page.title: 04Royston Parish Church
page.content: Our parish church is built of flints and stone. It is dedicated to St. John the Baptist. It was originally a priory church bought back by the townspeople 3 years after the dissolution of the monasteries by Henry V111. There are three special services:- baptisms, weddings and funerals. The baptisms are usually on Sundays, weddings on Saturdays and funerals can be on any day.The main services- Matins, Communion and Evensong are on Sundays.A choir leads the singing at many of the services.Music is played on the organ. There are church groups which meet in houses, a Sunday School and two youth groups. The 3 clergy visit people who are ill or in hospital. The church income is about 20,000 pounds a year.
